page.title: 01GAZETEER OF EPSOM AREA
page.content: {Epsom}is a bustling, suburban market town, some 25 km south-west of central London. In the 17th and 18th centuries Epsom was famous for its spa and its salts, but is now renowned for the horse race classic, the{Derby, which attracts half a million spectators annually. This block contains the centre of Epsom and residential areas in the west, north-west and south-western corners. In the north-eastern corner is recreational land and{NESCOT.}To the south of here is the Downs Farm. To the south, centrally, is{Epsom {College}and part of{Epsom Golf Course. The south-eastern corner is again residential.
